original_title: ADB to assist Sri Lanka water supply projects
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Representatives from the Asian Development Bank met government officials at the Presidential Secretariat, to discuss the upcoming water supply sector reform program in Sri Lanka.
The discussion focused on the policy planning and monitoring framework integral to the proposed reform program, which is set to be implemented through financial assistance from the ADB.
The reforms revolve around enhancing the management of climate-resilient, safe and environmentally sustainable water supply systems, a statement by the president’s media division said.

The execution of this initiative would be undertaken collaboratively by the prime minister’s office, the ministry of water supply and the National Water Supply and Drainage Board. (Colombo/Nov20/2023)
